event.title: 1987 when the 13th Amendment to the Constitution of Sri Lanka established

data.event: The provinces have existed since the 19th century but did not have any legal status until 1987 when the 13th Amendment to the Constitution of Sri Lanka established provincial councils.
In 1815 the British gained control of the entire island of Ceylon.

event.title: 1833, in accordance with the recommendations of the Colebrooke-Cameron Commission, the ethnic based administrative structures were unified

data.event: In 1833, in accordance with the recommendations of the Colebrooke-Cameron Commission, the ethnic based administrative structures were unified into a single administration divided into five geographic provinces.
